summary: This is a press release from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York announcing the death of Jeffrey Epstein in his cell at the Manhattan Correctional Center. The statement confirms the ongoing investigation into sex trafficking of minors and urges victims or witnesses to come forward.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued the official statement on behalf of the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding Jeffrey Epstein's death and the status of the ongoing investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The accused who was found dead in his cell at the Manhattan Correctional Center while facing federal charges of sex trafficking of minors.

connections.description: Berman, as the U.S. Attorney, was the lead federal prosecutor overseeing the criminal case against Epstein.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Manhattan Correctional Center and was pronounced dead shortly thereafter.

events.title: Ongoing Federal Investigation
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office confirms its investigation into the sex trafficking of minors, which included a conspiracy count, remains ongoing despite Epstein's death.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at the Manhattan Correctional Center on the morning of August 9, 2019.
Epstein was facing federal charges brought by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York for sex trafficking of minors, including a conspiracy count.
The U.S. Attorney's Office stated the investigation remains ongoing and urged victims or individuals with information to contact the FBI.
The statement acknowledges the potential for Epstein's death to be a hurdle for victims seeking justice in court.
